column4: anyone knows what is the best thing to do when you have a complete system freeze- no mouse, keyboard...is it a reboot?
its time to scream if you ever see something like this in ubuntu
it happens quite a bit to me ;)
then check ya /var/log ....your hardware got big problem ... apps crash .. for kernel itself to freeze is another thing
i have lot of crashes on kde apps
app crashes all the time ... but you said the whole OS froze
ya first its the apps then the whole system freezes
which log file should i look at
then its just more than apps crashing .. check ya /var/log/message
ok
if an app like amarok crashed would it be logged in /var/log/messages
yes

it looks ok to me-the messages log. but there are a lot of entries like this one Nov 13 11:32:56 bigbillcotton kernel: [4295159.494000]  atkbd.c: Unknown key released (translated set 2, code 0xaa on isa0060/serio0).
pls don't paste
sorry about that
here http://pastebin.com/427497
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-76271.html
thanks for the help, i dont think amarok is logging anything into messages. cause i just switched it on and it does not appear in my system tray. it has been doing this for a while
no problem .. btw can your nick be in small letters ?
do i have to do a set nick for that?
/nick corona
